intro: Acetosella distans, commonly known as the distant sorrel, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the Geraniaceae family. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are typically covered in fine hairs and have a reddish or purplish hue. The plant produces small, pink to red flowers that bloom in early spring, often in clusters at the ends of the stems. Acetosella distans is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental addition to gardens and natural habitats.
